hypercube module¶

class hypercube.Hypercube(coords)¶

Bases: object

A structure containing Examples. Number of its dimensions depends on how many attributes each Example has.

Parameters:coords – Coordinates of this particular Hypercube in Grid.
add_example(example)¶

Adds an Example to a Hypercube

Parameters:example – Element object to be added.
set_hypercube_class()¶

Sets the class of the Hypercube in the BasicGrid. If the Hypercube contains no examples, then the EMPTY_CLASS_INDICATOR is assigned as the class id. Otherwise the most frequent class is assigned. If they draw, assignment is random.

set_lower_level_hypercube_class(parent_hypercubes, threshold)¶

Sets the class of the Hypercube in LowerLevelGrid.

Parameters:
  • parent_hypercubes – list of Hypercubes from finer level, which create current Hypercube.
  • threshold – algorithm’s parameter - if the difference between the cardinalities of the two most frequent classes does not exceed the threshold value, then the MIXED_CLASS_INDICATOR is assigned.
update_basic(example_list)¶

Updates the Hypercube’s class after new Examples arrive.

Parameters:example_list – A list consisting of Examples of the same class within the same Hypercube.
Returns:Hypercube’s current class.
update_lower_level(example_class, example_count, threshold)¶

Updates the Hypercube’s class after new Examples arrive. This method is applicable to Hypercubes of the coarser Grids.

Parameters:
  • example_class – Class of provided examples.
  • example_count – Number of Examples of given class within the Hypercubes of the finer Grid that build the current Hypercube.
  • threshold – algorithm’s parameter - if the difference between the cardinalities of the two most frequent classes does not exceed the threshold value, then the MIXED_CLASS_INDICATOR is assigned.
Returns:

Hypercube’s current class.
